text: I do agree that some men act extremely inappropriate at times. But there’s no such thing as toxic masculinity. Those men that do those inappropriate acts have nothing to do with masculinity, they are just acting childish. I don’t get why people put the word toxic in front of masculinity.
Oh now I have to go check it out! 🤣
I havent seen it! Will look it up 💕
Haha! I have got to check it out now. 😃🌸
Loving this.  You made me pee my pants! 😂😂
I haven't see this! I'll have to take a look 😁
@motherofsnot exactly. Decent human beings see the ad and like what it represents

Great picture and post! Yes, that reaction is the typical "wounded masculine" response pulling both men and women out of their comfort zone with what they know as the traditional paradigm of masculinity. There is a positive men's movement underway, but we have a ton of work to do....💙💪
@motherofsnot 😂😂😂
@motherofsnot i loved it! Men cant handle anything 🙃 haha we have living evidence in many homes around the world 🤷🏻‍♀️😂
@the.baking.mum oh! *i shed a tear too* 🤗🤗

@momdoingmomthings exactly! If a person is having a fit over being told to be kind and respectful, it may be because their conscience isn’t totally clean in that department. Anyone I know who is generally kind and respectful is totally cool with the add. Red flags for all the man-babies throwing a tantrum! 💪🏻💪🏻
@treasuredhomeschool he he! Thanks Mama! 😆😆 Do check out the ad and let me know what you think. Gillette May be jumping on the bandwagon, but I’m here for the conversation it sparks! 👏🏻👏🏻

@markloewen.author 😆😆 that’s a great quote!! I also liked the one that said...
Gillette: men can be better
500k men: oh no we fu*king can’t!!!
What a ridiculous response! I think they do need a safe space, poor babies! 😆😭😆
@grace.laura.q exactly! But that seems to be too much for some people 🤨🤨
@watchherrun such a good reply! God is hilarious on Facebook! Cheers Running-Mama!! 👏🏻👏🏻

@noor_apparel_au omg, right? Did you see that tweet I shared in my Stories? About the huge list of ways women are targeted and shamed and controlled through advertising but there’s no massive social media backlash. Then there’s one ad that says ‘maybe men can do better’ and the man-babies lose their minds. Maybe they need to toughen up like us women!! 💪🏻💪🏻😀

@izzyproudfoot Yep, the campaign is definitely working out well for Gillette because everyone is talking about it! I watched it because so many (kind and thoughtful) people sent it to for my opinion. Big companies have a huge platform, and more and more people are demanding that they stand for something. I know it’s just business/sales for them, but hey, if it sparks this kind of conversation I’m willing to give them a pass for it! 👏🏻😀⭐️

@the.baking.mum I she’s a tear too! 😭 I think the people who have such a problem with it are exactly the people it’s aimed at. All the men I know who don’t sexually harass people/aren’t homophonic/don’t bully aren’t offended at all by this ad. It’s because their conscience is clear... unlike the man-babies having a tantrum over it! 👏🏻💪🏻⭐️

@whknee I get what you mean... I don’t really want to be here promoting a big corporation and I don’t use their products... but I do like that they’re taking responsibility for their messaging (which has a global impact) and joining the conversation. If they have to say something, at least it can be positive and empowering! 💪🏻💪🏻
@tosh.roo exactly! Isn’t that terrible! Just like the ad says, men should be able to express their emotions healthily without risking being mocked for being less manly! Glad we agree on that!! 💪🏻💪🏻

@newmomstribe exactly! And if you saw an ad that said ‘hey, let’s be kinder’ would you think it was an awful thing to say? Because I tend to think the people who have a problem with this ad are exactly the people who the ad is aimed at, if you know what I mean) 👏🏻👏🏻
@missjemmarayne do check it out and let me know what you think. I know it’s a little exploitative/bandwagon-ish, but still, I’m so happy that this is a topic big companies are talking about now! 👏🏻👏🏻
@lentilandmama I know! What I don’t get is, what do these men think masculinity is? The ad literally just says don’t sexually harass or bully people. Those aren’t thing a ‘real man’ does anyhoo! 🤨😕💪🏻
@rickwiik ok, thank you. I don’t totally get what you mean but I do appreciate you taking the time to stop by. 😀
@livlunamasha I think it’s international. The response (and cry baby backlash) has been global too! 👏🏻👏🏻😀
@idothisforfrankie kudos indeed! If they had to jump in a bandwagon, I’m so happy this is the one they chose! 👏🏻👏🏻💪🏻⭐️
I did see the ad and kudos to them!
oh i cannot wait to watch it i will google it is it a UK ad?
Yes, you may not like it, but in Gilettes perfect world, this is the top of masculine petfoemance.
I need to see this advert!!! What a joke!🙈
I haven’t seen this!! I will have to go look it up!
I haven’t seen it! Going to check it out now, but I’m all about everyone being more kind to one another! 🙌
@motherofsnot true, and at least they will throw some money at it by supporting appropriate charitable causes.
Ah of course “show more emotions” but if we do we are called weak and oppressed and told we should be more “manly” #hypocrite

I wasn't offended at all. But of course I shouldn't be surprised there are so many offended people (probably men and women alike). Still a big corporation trying to stay relevant and make money. Everything they do leads back to making money as priority number 1. But I like the message. I personally use an old school razor and blades cost me less than $0.10, Gillette is expensive af. #futureisfemale

I watched it with my husband and I was in tears, so much of it rang true.  My husband totally understood and said it was amazing. I cannot understand how anyone can watch that and not be moved nor understand how men can make such great changes to society. Xx
I have to admit I haven't seen it but I've seen a lot of conversations about it!!
Omg this is just gold 🙌👍❤️❤️❤️ seriously nice to see men being targeted for once and they are so freaked loll
There's a reply on "God's" Facebook page that says "Men, if you're offended by the Gillette commercial, maybe you should try smiling. You're prettier when you smile". It's a GREAT commercial. 💪
It’s pretty simply, ‘treat others how you yourself would like to be treated’. The end. 😝

I couldn’t believe the response. My favorite quote was, “Apparently Gillette is not good for sensitive skin after all!” 😂 Should we set up a safe space for men who feel threatened by a commercial that tells them men can be respectful and kind?
So this photo is great!! I haven't seen it, but like @mercedesmakingmemories said now I feel like I am going to check it out!

My fiance is always calling me a feminist over things like this but I honestly think that if you're going to throw a fit over a commercial about a huge problem in America instead of saying "yeah that's a good message" then you're part of the issue. Do these same people get upset about breast cancer commercials or humane society commercials? But there should be one for women too. And to comment on someone above... If what's between their legs isn't between yours it shouldn't matter. If it's not a toxic relationship it shouldn't matter. If it's not effecting you or others in a negative way... It shouldn't matter.
@mercedesmakingmemories well I don’t mean to be doing advertising on behalf of a multinational corporation that sells disposable plastic stuff... but yes, the message in this ad is good! 👏🏻👏🏻😀

@iiixixmcmxciii @iiixixmcmxciii well I’m glad we agree! Let men be men and women be women! Just like the ad says! 
The ad addresses sexual harassment and bullying. Are you saying that’s an inherent part of being masculine? (Because if you are, let’s chat. Sounds like you could do with a hug and a helping hand).
@lounnieb yessss!! Go sit on a shit! I coined that phrase late one evening by accident and I think it should become a thing. This seems like the most appropriate place to use it!! 😆😆
Now I feel I have to watch this

That is not what people are angry about missy - thinks she knows. What people are angry about is the attack on men masculine like telling men that they should not be men because that is bad somehow or generalizing all men like if soy men are any better. Let men be men and women be women. There’s is nothing toxic about being a men there is just bad parenting perhaps instead of talking about toxic masculinity why don’t you focus on reestablishing family because in complete families children grow up to be better than in single parent household

Hahaha love this picture and message.  But I do agree with the message.  Some may feel threatened by this message because they are insecure about themselves.  So yep they can go sit on a shit like you said! 🤣🤣🤣

@kyanos I know what you mean! It’s all just clever marketing in the end, but marketing is exploitative in general, right?! I’m willing to give them a pass on this one because big companies have a responsibility to use their platform for good, for once. And toxic masculinity is literally killing people. (I assume you hate their disposable razors though right? Totally agree with you on that) 💪🏻💪🏻
So great - we will share! ✊✊✊
@athomemaker 💥💥 totally! People are daft sometimes! 💪🏻💪🏻
@crannaindia Yeay!! I was going to tag you for the ‘ go sit on a shit’ comment alone!! 😆💪🏻⭐️💩
@feminismisforboys I thought we might have a similar kind of reaction!! 👏🏻💪🏻⭐️😀
@beyoudcor Right? How fragile is their ego that an ad hurt them this much?! 👀
Wowwwww I can’t believe this!! Some people I literally feel sorry for smhhh🙄🙄
Seriously!!! My thoughts exactly!!!! 👏🏿👏🏾👏🏽👏🏼👏🏻
Yes. Yes. And YES to all this!
@brendandempsey77 ha! 😆Would you look at the state of us! Maybe it’s genetic! 😆😆
Haven't seen it yet, read about it a bit but your caption makes me want to see it. The problem is that I really don't like Gillette 😅
@daddy_4_times_ exactly! They’ve been leading the narrative for years on what a ‘real man’ is, and it’s been problematic all along. Bout time they started to be more responsible! 👏🏻👏🏻
@alexandria.pratt 😆😆 thank you! Yes and yes!! 💪🏻💪🏻
@daddyfootandco cool! You rock!  Im going to pop over there and check it out! 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻
@motherofsnot looks like we both made spelling mistakes 😬 although a “puss” take sounds like part of of “shot show” 😉 Keep up the good work.
@brendandempsey77 you so did! Thanks bro! What a total joke... and bit of a shot show! 👍🏻👍🏻
Glad to have inspired you to this post and so that you could see the online reaction and puss take. Hilarious 😂. What a joke. #bestamancanget
I wrote a piece on it myself. I’m no bothered about it
@motherofsnot same here 😂
Hahahaha 🙌 yes

I've just caught the ad today but been seeing all the hype. It's a great fucking advert.  I just saw it and thought about time these big multi national businesses that heavily influence the typical male stood up and said "hey guys you know what? It's ok to have feelings and treat others with respect & kindness now go home and hug your kids" Why is the world losing its mind over this?! 🤯
@motherofsnot Love them!
@whatdevondiscovered Thanks Mama! There were so many hilarious, entertaining and insightful clap backs, I just had to share a few!! 😆👏🏻⭐️❤️
@mr_allabouthurr ahh, your crew are lucky to have a dad like you to  help them understand how to have a healthy relationship with their emotions and how to be good humans!! 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻

@therealtobytobz yeah, it’s a bit exploitative to be fair, but then so are alllll the other ads and no one is giving out about them. At least this one is sparking conversation and trying to lead a change! 💪🏻💪🏻
@katieinthecountry it IS so toxic! You’re right! And it highlights exactly why the ad is actually right! 👏🏻👏🏻
@the_girly_reports Right? Like, perhaps the ad hit a nerve? And then perhaps then that person is EXACTLY who the ad is aimed at and they should start listening! 💪🏻💪🏻

I don’t mind crying, and showing my emotions talking through our problems. I don’t mind cleaning, cooking, doing the shopping, sharing the work load,  reading at bedtime, kissing my children on the lips, telling them I love them and they can be everything and anything they aspire to be, helping with homework showing them an honest interpretation of love honesty and respecting my wife. Teaching my boys and girls what it is to work and earn their right to the respect of others, how the world is a better place if you use your manners and smile. What I do mind is that its not just angled to a specific gender that they are taught to believe that it’s the same equality to all no matter your gender,  sexuality,  race disability that they view the world with rainbow glasses and all that is enveloped in it.
Exactly! Personally I feel that anyone who takes offense to an ad has some severe insecurities

Can’t believe this still upsetting ppl and also that a grooming men’s company will use the message for their campaign in 2019! But then again we do need to talk about it! So whatever way it’s good I supposed xx
The toxic reaction is so ironic. Being kind isn't about being masculine or feminine, it's about being a decent human. Something we should all strive for!
@mskatecasanova he he! The real joke is how long it’s been since I actually shaved anything!! 😱🤪😭😆
@mylifeinacartoon he he! I love it when a plan comes together!! Thanks Mama!! 👏🏻👏🏻
🙌 yup! the advert was Good and i can not see a problem with it!
@motherofsnot well that is the plan !!! 😍😍😍
@motherofsnot well that is the plan !!! 😍😍😍
Great photo hazel! 💪
Awesome post and awesome lead in to your stories. I'm going to look at them and I'm going to steal the idea.🙌
@vikki.vo 💪🏻💪🏻💪🏻 seriously! 😀
@mischievous_words thank you!! It should kind of go without saying... but alas apparently not! 😭💪🏻💪🏻
@mylifeinacartoon 😋 totally cool with that Mama! 💪🏻💪🏻❤️
@adventures.with.mase exactly! They’re getting a bit of flack for jumping on a trend, but I’m willing to forgive them.m for it! 👏🏻👏🏻⭐️
@5idiotsanddave do it! And let me know what you think! 😀 It actually brought a tear to my eye, imagine how much suffering could be eliminated if we’d been teaching kids this all along? 😭💪🏻💪🏻❤️
I love the message "Boys can cry. Women deserve respect. Being kind is cool."
@whatkatiedidnext18 isn’t it?!! It’s definitely jumping on the bandwagon a bit, but who cares! It’s a conversation that needs to be broadcast!! 👏🏻👏🏻
What a crazy world we live in! The think the add is great and so relevant! Xx
I'm going to have to find it and watch it.  I've heard so much about it
I saw the ad and I’m glad they are using their platform to promote a positive message.
Wow !!! You’ll definitely raise some eyebrows with this one !!! 😍
